sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Karma is an alert dashboard for Alertmanager. It allows the aggregation and deduplication of alerts, as well as the possibility of silencing alerts.

sections.title: Installation
sections.content: Install the karma-dashboardAUR or karma-dashboard-binAUR package.

sections.title: Configuration
sections.content: Karma configuration is done by editing /etc/karma/karma.yml and starting karma.service.

sections.title: Changing alertmanager protocol, address and port
sections.content:
The default configuration assumes that alertmanager runs on http://localhost:9093. Change the uri parameter to match your configuration.

```
/etc/karma/karma.yml
```

```
alertmanager:
  interval: 1m
  servers:
    - name: production
      uri: ALERTMANAGER_PROTOCOL://ALERTMANAGER_ADDRESS:ALERTMANAGER_PORT/
      timeout: 20s
      proxy: false
      readonly: true
```

sections.title: Changing listening address and port
sections.content:
You may want to change the default address and port on which karma listens. To do so, edit /etc/karma/karma.yml and add the following parameters:

```
/etc/karma/karma.yml
```

```
listen:
  address: KARMA_ADDRESS
  port: KARMA_PORT
```

sections.title: Starting karma
sections.content: After starting and enabling karma.service, the application can be reached via HTTP on localhost:8080 by default.
